page.title: 12POPLAR HALL FARM BY CLARE H.
page.content: MR.MACAULEY SHOWED US AROUND HIS FARM. IT IS A LARGE FARM OF 680 ACRES. HE GROWS 310 ACRES OF WINTER WHEAT, 80 ACRES OF WINTER BARLEY, 100 ACRES OF SUGAR BEET, 80 ACRES OF PEAS AND 80 ACRES OF POTATOES. SEVEN ACRES OF HIS LAND ARE TAKEN UP BY A RESERVOIR WHICH HOLDS 10 MILLION GALLONS OF WATER. MR. MACAULEY BUILT THE RESERVOIR TO IRRIGATE HIS POTATO AND SUGAR BEET CROPS. THE WATER CAN BE SPRAYED AT 300 GALLONS A MINUTE. THE RESERVOIR HAS BECOME QUITE A CONSERVATION AREA; MANY DUCKS AND WADING BIRDS, BUTTERFLIES AND INSECTS LIVE ON AND AROUND IT. MR MACAULEY ALSO KEEPS PIGS. HE HAS 200 BREEDING SOWS, 240 PIGLETS, 320 WEANERS AND 320 FATTENERS. HE HAS FIVE FULL TIME WORKERS,(1 PIGMAN AND 4 TRACTOR DRIVERS) HE ALSO EMPLOYS SOME PART TIME CASUAL WORKERS.
